Class BigTwo

  • java.lang.Object
    • BigTwo
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CardGame

    public class BigTwo
extends java.lang.Object
implements CardGame
    BigTwo class implements the CardGame interface and is used to model a Big Two card game by using the instance variables and methods of this class as well as other classes
    Author:
    vanshajchadha

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BigTwo()
      A constructor for creating a Big Two card game by creating the ArrayList of players, handsOnTable and creating an object for BigTwoTable in order to get the GUI and handle user actions

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Creates a Big Two card game, creates and shuffles a deck of cards, and starts the game with that deck of cards
        Parameters:
        args - an array of String values used for command line

      • composeHand

        public static Hand composeHand(CardGamePlayer player,
                               CardList cards)
        Returns a valid hand from the specified list of cards of the player and null is no valid hand can be composed from the specified list of cards
        Parameters:
        player - a CardGamePlayer reference pointing to the object containing the name of the player and list of cards held by him in the game
        cards - a CardList reference pointing to the object containing the set of cards which need to be checked to see if they form a valid hand or not
        Returns:
        a Hand reference pointing to the object containing the data for the player along with the list of cards forming a valid hand, otherwise null

        public int getNumOfPlayers()
        Returns the number of players in this card game.

        Returns:
        the number of players in this card game

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        playerID - the playerID of the player who makes the move
        cardIdx - the list of the indices of the cards selected by the player
